DZ,

I would like this. I hope others will share in kind.
  I am in the process of trying to improve my
photography of tsuba, and would be willing to put up
some of mine, along with relevant drawings, as a
'dissection' of them as I currently understand them.
But it would be best to do so with only NTHK or NBTHK
papered pieces. Afraid many of those I have at hand
currently are not papered. Still, willing to
try-though my questionable photography skills may
scuttle the effort. 

Curran


--- David Zincavage <jdz@...> wrote:

> I have an additional suggestion.  Perhaps each of
> those among us who collect and study tsuba might
> take the time to write a few paragraphs identifying
> the particular merits of, and reasons for
> collecting, a particular school.  The really
> outspoken might go farther and identify a school, or
> type, of tsuba they do not collect, and explain why.
> 
> DZ     
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: klepet33319 
>   To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Sunday, March 12, 2006 3:42 PM
>   Subject: [nihontostudy] Kantei
> 
> 
>   I for one have enjoyed Jim's kantei(s).  I am
> wondering if the other 
>   members concur and if they might like something
> like a regular kantei, 
>   possibly Friday with answer on Sunday?  Or
> bi-weekly? Perhaps we could 
>   generate a list of those interested in submitting
> their treasures with 
>   one member being chosen by Jim each week.  Then
> that party could post a 
>   picture with Jim giving his ideas at the close of
> the bidding.  That 
>   way he'd be on the hot-seat as well (although I
> think luke warm in his 
>   case at best LOL).  Just some thoughts.
> 
> 
>
